Physiological mechanisms related to reproduction, breeding efficiency and
fertility, with special reference to domestic animals.

name: ICA Sports Program
description:
Classes offered in all UC Davis intercollegiate athletic sports and are
restricted to student-athletes who are members.

name: Musics of the World
description:
Survey of selected art, folk, and popular music cultures from different parts
of the world. Emphasis on understanding relationship of musical style,
aesthetic principles, and performance practice to wider cultural contexts.

name: Coaching Principles
description:
Technical, tactical, and strategic aspects of coaching. Methods for organizing
and delivering effective information in coaching. Biomechanical basis of motor
skills and motor learning principles applied to coaching. Classroom
development of coaching skills and outside observations of coaching required.

name: Voice
description: Individual instruction in voice.
prereq: Consent of Instructor. Admission by audition.

name: Urban Ecology
description:
Application of fundamental concepts and approaches in landscape and ecosystem
ecology to urban ecosystems. Ecological and social drivers and responses.
Landscape heterogeneity, nutrient dynamics, invasive species, altered
hydrology and climate, and pollution. Discussion of primary literature.
prereq:
Course in general or plant ecology such as PLB 117, ESP 100, EVE 101, EVE 120
or PLS 163.

name: Intro to Mil Skills
description:
Continuation of development of leadership and military skills introduced in
MSC 014A. Emphasis on the role of the individual, the basic organizational
element of the Army, the squad. Supervisory controls reduced as students gain
capabilities.
prereq: Consent of Instructor. Lower division standing.

name: Biology of Addiction
description:
Broad examination of addictive substances and their use/abuse. Topics include
historical perspective, physiological effects, etiology, neurobiology of
addiction and the impact of drugs on contemporary society. Intended for non-
science majors.

name: Topics in Physics
description:
Emphasis varies: survey of basic principles or a deeper exploration of some
particular branch. Past topics included black holes, space time, and
relativity; physics of music; history and philosophy; energy and the
environment; and natural phenomena.

name: NA Art Studio
description:
Studio projects to be influenced by contemporary and traditional Native
American arts. Examples of designs and media presented in lectures will be of
indigenous origin. Introduction and familiarized with various materials and
techniques.

name: Coaching Effectiveness
description:
Synthesis and application of basic components of sport psychology, sport
pedagogy, and sport physiology and basic management and administration of
athletics in public high schools.
prereq: Upper division standing; 3 units of PHE 001 and PHE 006 combined.

name: Systemic Physiology
description:
Systemic physiology with emphasis on aspects of human physiology. Functions of
major organ systems, with the structure of those systems described as a basis
for understanding the functions.
prereq: BIS 001A or BIS 002A; CHE 002B; PHY 001B or PHY 007C strongly recommended.

name: Plants & Society
description:
Dependence of human societies on plant and plant products. Plants as resources
for food, fiber, health, enjoyment and environmental services. Sustainable
uses of plants for food production, raw materials, bioenergy, and
environmental conservation. Global population growth and future food supplies.

name: Elementary Persian
description:
Continuation of course 001. Introduction to listening, speaking, reading and
writing skills in Persian and to Persian culture.

name: PE Internship
description:
Work experience in the application of physical activity programs to teaching,
recreational, clinical or research situations under department faculty
supervision.
prereq:
Upper division standing and consent of instructor; enrollment dependent on
availability of intern positions, with priority given to Exercise Science
majors.

name: Intro Phil Science
description:
Basic problems in the philosophy of science, common to the physical,
biological, and social sciences. Analysis of explanation, confirmation theory,
observational and theoretical terms, the nature of theories, operationalism
and behaviorism, realism, reduction.

name: Physical Activities
description:
Physical Education Activities classes offered in the following areas:
aquatics, personal fitness, martial arts, individual sports, and team sports.
These academic classes are instructional rather than recreational and are
intended to improve activity specific skills and knowledge.

name: Prof Act Men & Wom
description:
Fundamental skills for: (a) coaching competitive athletics; (b) classroom
teaching and coaching, and (c) classroom teaching and officiating. May be
repeated for a total of six units.

name: General Physics
description:
Introduction to general principles and analytical methods used in physics for
students majoring in a biological science.

name: Nutrition Practicum
description:
Fundamental principles of planning and evaluating therapeutic diets and
patient education for pathological conditions covered in NUT 116B.
Continuation of NUT 116AL.

name: Systemic Physiology
description:
Systemic physiology with emphasis on aspects of human physiology. Functions of
major organ systems, with the structure of those systems described as a basis
for understanding the functions.
prereq: BIS 001A or BIS 002A; CHE 002B; PHY 001B or PHY 007C strongly recommended.

name: Neurobiology Foundations
description:
Core concepts of neurobiology including single-neuron biophysics, synapses and
transmitters, neuronal development, motor systems, central pattern generation,
neuronal circuits, intracellular signal transduction, sensory processing,
multisensory integration, autonomic nervous system, neuromodulation, learning
and memory, and higher cognition and disease.
prereq: NPB 110A C- or better; PHY 007A and PHY 007B recommended.

name: General Physics
description: Continuation of PHY 007A.

name: Intro to NA Lit
description:
Intensive focus on analysis of Native American literary texts, with frequent
writing assignments to develop critical thinking and composition skills.

name: Journalism in Nutrition
description:
Critical analysis and discussion of current, controversial issues in
nutrition; the use of journalistic techniques to interpret scientific findings
for the lay public. Students will be required to write several articles for
campus media. Course may be repeated once for credit.
prereq: NUT 111; A course in written or oral expression or consent of instructor.

name: Physical Activities
description:
Physical Education Activities classes offered in the following areas:
aquatics, personal fitness, martial arts, individual sports, and team sports.
These academic classes are instructional rather than recreational and are
intended to improve activity specific skills and knowledge.

name: Neurobiology
description:
Brains and nervous systems, neurons and neural circuits. Coordination of
movement. Development of nervous systems. Vision, hearing, and feature
extraction by the central nervous system. The cell biology of learning and
memory. Perception, cognition, and disorders of the brain.
prereq:
BIS 002A; BIS 002B; BIS 002C; PHY 009A, 009B, 009C or PHY 007A, 007B, 007C
recommended.

name: Physical Activities
description:
Physical Education Activities classes offered in the following areas:
aquatics, personal fitness, martial arts, individual sports, and team sports.
These academic classes are instructional rather than recreational and are
intended to improve activity specific skills and knowledge.

name: General Physics
description: Continuation of PHY 007A.

name: Complex Variables
description:
Complex number system, analyticity and the Cauchy-Riemann equations,
elementary functions, complex integration, power and Laurent series
expansions, residue theory.

name: Classical Physics
description: Electricity and magnetism including circuits and Maxwell's equations.
prereq: PHY 009B; MAT 021D; MAT 022A { can be concurrent }

name: University Concert Band
description: Rehearsal and performance of music for band.
prereq: Consent of Instructor. Admission by audition.

name: Folk Musics of Europe
description:
Survey of folk musics from all of Europe, with emphasis on the role of music
in society and on the elements of music (instruments, genres, form, etc.).
Introduction to ethnomusicological theory, methods, approaches.
prereq: MUS 011 or MUS 003A or MUS 010; or Consent of Instructor.

name: Physical Activities
description:
Physical Education Activities classes offered in the following areas:
aquatics, personal fitness, martial arts, individual sports, and team sports.
These academic classes are instructional rather than recreational and are
intended to improve activity specific skills and knowledge.

name: Special Study
description: Special study for advanced undergraduates.

name: Directed Gp Study
description: Directed group study.

name: Modern Algebra
description: Bilinear forms, rings, factorization, modules.

name: Minds Brains Comp w/Disc
description:
Computational theories of the nature of the mind. Mind as a computer process.
Possibility of machine intelligence, consciousness, and mentality.

name: Elem Human Physiology
description:
Introduction to physiology for non-science majors. Includes basic cell
physiology and survey of major organ systems and how they function in
homeostasis and human health.

name: Agric & the Environment
description:
Focus on the interaction between agriculture and the environment to address
the principles required to analyze conflict and develop solutions to complex
problems facing society.

name: Tutoring Math
description:
Special projects in mathematical education developing techniques for
mathematics instruction and tutoring on an individual or small group basis.

name: Illusions and the Brain
description: Introduction to perceptual processing in the human nervous system; illusions.

name: Shifa Clinic
description:
Attend clinic every third Sunday performing duties of receptionist, intake,
translation, monitor. Students attend a meeting immediately after end of
clinic. There is a mandatory Monday meeting with Clinic co-directors. Students
are expected to participate on various committees.
prereq:
Consent of Instructor. The applications will be available for students.
Selection of students will be made by selection committee of medical students
coordinators and the IOR.

name: Solid State Physics
description:
Survey of fundamental ideas in the physics of solids, with selected device
applications. Crystal structure, x-ray and neutron diffraction, phonons,
simple metals, energy bands and Fermi surfaces, semiconductors, optical
properties, magnetism, superconductivity.
prereq:
PHY 115A C- or better; or equivalent course passed with C- or better, or
consent of instructor.

name: Drugs & Society
description:
Pharmacology, methods of use, and effects of use of psychoactive and
performance-enhancing drugs. Historical overview of drug use. Identification
of behavior of at-risk and user populations.

name: Plant Morphology
description:
Introduction to the form, development and evolution of vascular plants.
Emphasis given to the form and development of reproductive structures in ferns
and seed-producing plants as a basis for determining evolutionary
relationships.

name: Handmade Elec Music
description: Continuation of course 107A.

name: Plant Growth & Yield Lab
description:
Laboratory exercises in plant growth and development and their regulation,
including photomorphogenesis, plant growth regulators, plant anatomy, seed
germination, fruit ripening and senescence. Includes field trips to illustrate
relationships to cropping and marketing systems.
prereq: PLS 100B { can be concurrent }; Or equivalent.

name: University Symphony
description:
Open to any student in the University whose proficiency meets the requirements
of concert performance. Sight-reading, rehearsal and performance of music from
the orchestral literature.
prereq: Consent of Instructor. Admission by audition.

name: General Physics
description: Continuation of PHY 007B.

name: Metalogic
description:
The metalogic of classical propositional and first-order predicate logic.
Consistency, soundness and completeness of both propositional and predicate
logic. The Lwenheim-Skolem theorem for predicate logic. Undecidablity of
predicate logic.

name: Phys Reprod Lab
description:
Experiments on the reproductive systems of domestic animals including male and
female gametes.

name: Restoration Practicum
description:
Hands-on field exposure to various aspects of ecological restoration
throughout the seasonal restoration cycle with real-world practitioners.
Emphasis on grassland/rangeland, riparian, and oak woodland communities.

name: Intro to NA Lit
description:
Intensive focus on analysis of Native American literary texts, with frequent
writing assignments to develop critical thinking and composition skills.

name: Advanced Calculus
description:
Introduction to the rigorous treatment of abstract mathematical analysis.
Proofs in mathematics, induction, sets, cardinality; real number system,
theory of convergence of sequences.

name: Physical Activities
description:
Physical Education Activities classes offered in the following areas:
aquatics, personal fitness, martial arts, individual sports, and team sports.
These academic classes are instructional rather than recreational and are
intended to improve activity specific skills and knowledge.

name: Intro to Cosmology
description:
Contemporary knowledge regarding the origin of the universe, including the Big
Bang and nucleosynthesis, microwave background radiation, formation of cosmic
structure, cosmic inflation, cosmic acceleration and dark energy.
prereq:
PHY 009A; PHY 009B; PHY 009C; PHY 009D; PHY 105A { can be concurrent }; or
Consent of Instructor. PHY 105A required concurrently.

name: Plant Breeding
description:
Principles, methods and applications of plant breeding and genetics to the
improvement of crop plants. Illustration of how plant breeding is a dynamic,
multidisciplinary, constantly-evolving science. Laboratory emphasizes hands-on
experience in the basics of breeding through experiments.
prereq: PLS 152 or BIS 101; or Consent of Instructor.

name: General Virology
description:
Integrated presentation of the nature of animal, bacterial, and plant viruses,
including their structure, replication and genetics.

name: Directed Group Study
description: Directed group study.

name: University Chorus
description: Rehearsal and performance of choral music.
prereq: Consent of Instructor. Admission by audition.

name: Adv Eukaryotic Genetics
description:
Five basic operations of genetic analysis: mutation, segregation,
recombination, complementation, and regulation. Emphasis on the theory and
practice of isolating and analyzing mutations, as well as understanding
mechanisms underlying both Mendelian and epigenetic inheritance.

name: Ecosystem&Landscape Eco
description:
Integration of concepts to understand and manage ecosystems in a complex and
changing world. Emphasis on interactions among biotic, abiotic and human
factors and changes over space/time. Local to global controls over water,
carbon and nutrients across ecosystems/landscapes.
prereq:
Course in general, plant, or soil ecology such as EVE 117, PLB 117, ESP 100,
EVE 101, or SSC 112.

name: Physical Activities
description:
Physical Education Activities classes offered in the following areas:
aquatics, personal fitness, martial arts, individual sports, and team sports.
These academic classes are instructional rather than recreational and are
intended to improve activity specific skills and knowledge.

name: Principles Physics
description:
Mechanics. Introduction to general principles and analytical methods used in
physics with emphasis on applications in applied agricultural and biological
sciences and in physical education.

name: Animal Behavior
description:
Basic principles of behavioral organization in vertebrate and invertebrate
animals. Underlying physiological and ethological mechanisms. The evolution of
behavior, with special emphasis on behavior under natural conditions.

name: Internship
description:
Work experience on or off campus in practical application of nutrition,
supervised by a faculty member.
prereq: Consent of Instructor. One upper division course in nutrition.

name: Cyborgs & Prostheses
description:
Interface of biology and technology. Mind-controlled prosthetic limbs,
artificial organs, and implantable devices. Emphasis on basic physiological
functions and how they can be replaced by devices. Suitable for majors and
non-majors.

name: Developmental Nutrition
description: Role of nutritional factors in embryonic and postnatal development.

name: Physical Activities
description:
Physical Education Activities classes offered in the following areas:
aquatics, personal fitness, martial arts, individual sports, and team sports.
These academic classes are instructional rather than recreational and are
intended to improve activity specific skills and knowledge.

name: Elementary Accounting
description:
Basic concepts of accounting; interpreting and using financial statements;
understanding accounting principles.

name: Probability
description:
Probability space; discrete probability, combinatorial analysis; independence,
conditional probability; random variables, discrete and continuous
distributions, probability mass function, joint and marginal density
functions; expectation, moments, variance, Chebyshev inequality; sums of
random variables, random walk, large number law, central limit theorem.

name: Proseminar in Nutrition
description:
Discussion of human nutrition problems. Each term will involve a different
emphasis among experimental, clinical, and dietetic problems of community,
national and international scope.

name: Plant Biochemistry
description:
The biochemistry of important plant processes and metabolic pathways.
Discussion of methods used to understand plant processes, including use of
transgenic plants.

name: Physical Activities
description:
Physical Education Activities classes offered in the following areas:
aquatics, personal fitness, martial arts, individual sports, and team sports.
These academic classes are instructional rather than recreational and are
intended to improve activity specific skills and knowledge.

name: Neurobiol Addict Drugs
description:
Neurobiological basis for the effects and mechanisms of action of drugs with
addictive potential, including opiates (morphine, heroin, methadone),
amphetamines, cocaine, nicotine, marijuana (cannabinoids), alcohol, caffeine,
and mind-altering drugs such as LSD and antidepressants.
prereq: NPB 100 or NPB 101; Or the equivalent.

name: Electronics
description:
Continuation of PHY 116A. Introduction to the use of digital electronics and
microcomputers in experimental physics. Nonlinear electronics, integrated
circuits, analog-to-digital and digital-to-analog converters, transducers,
actuators.
prereq: PHY 009C or PHY 009HD; or Consent of Instructor.

name: Brazilian Samba School
description:
Practice of Brasilian music. Basic instrumental technique and repertory. Focus
on the percussion traditions of Rio de Janeiro and Bahia.

name: Aristotle
description:
Overview of Aristotles most central and influential writings. Topics selected
from fields such as metaphysics, physics, ethics, logic, and psychology.

name: Philosophy of Biology
description:
Scientific method in biology. Nature of biological theories, explanations, and
models. Problems of evolutionary theory, ecology, genetics, and sociobiology.
Science and human values.
prereq: One course in Biology or one course in Philosophy recommended.

name: NA Performance & Culture
description:
Interdisciplinary study of public expressive forms among Native Americans.
Comparison and analysis of music, dances, rituals, and dramas from throughout
North, Central, and South America in their social and cultural contexts.
Extensive film viewing.
prereq:
Upper division standing in division of humanities or social sciences or
consent of instructor.

name: Complex Variables
description:
Complex number system, analyticity and the Cauchy-Riemann equations,
elementary functions, complex integration, power and Laurent series
expansions, residue theory.

name: General Relativity
description:
Definition of the mathematical frame work for the description of the
gravitational field, introduction of the dynamical equations of Einstein
governing its evolution and review of the key solutions, including black holes
and expanding universes.
prereq:
PHY 104A; PHY 105A; PHY 105B; PHY 110A; PHY 105B and PHY 110A or consent of
instructor.

name: Comp Vert Organology
description:
Functional anatomy of major organ systems in vertebrates. Each system examined
from cellular to gross level in fish, birds, and mammals. Emphasis on how
differentiated cell types are integrated into tissues and organs to perform
diverse physiological functions.

name: Mil Training Skills
description:
Enhancement of student leadership performance through practical application.
Small unit military tactical operations serve as the basis for student
exploration and development.
prereq: MSC 142; or Consent of Instructor. Upper division standing.

name: Elem Part Physics
description:
Properties and classification of elementary particles and their interactions.
Experimental techniques. Conservation laws and symmetries. Strong,
electromagnetic, and weak interactions. Introduction to Feynman calculus.
prereq: PHY 115A C- or better; or Consent of Instructor.

name: Stdnt-Athlete Lifeskills
description:
For intercollegiate student-athletes. Balancing academic and athletic demands.
Academic, psychological, and sociocultural issues which influence success as a
college student-athlete.

name: Critical Reasoning
description:
Criteria of good reasoning in everyday life and in science. Topics to be
covered may include basic principles of deduction and induction; fallacies in
reasoning; techniques and aids to reasoning; principles of scientific
investigation; aids to clarity.

name: Plant Biochemistry
description:
The biochemistry of important plant processes and metabolic pathways.
Discussion of methods used to understand plant processes, including use of
transgenic plants.

name: Environmental Ethics
description:
Conceptual and ethical issues concerning the environment. Extension of ethical
theory to animals, all life, and ecosystem wholes. Topics may include
contemporary environmental issues such as global warming, sustainability and
biodiversity.

name: Comparative Perspectives
description:
Ethnographic and historical points of intersection and divergence in various
aspects of the Middle East and South Asia in precolonial, colonial, and
postcolonial societies. Anthropological, historical, and theoretical debates
surrounding the region.

name: Physical Activities
description:
Physical Education Activities classes offered in the following areas:
aquatics, personal fitness, martial arts, individual sports, and team sports.
These academic classes are instructional rather than recreational and are
intended to improve activity specific skills and knowledge.

name: Elementary Musicianship
description:
Melodic, rhythmic, and harmonic materials of Western music. Includes sight
singing, explanations, drills, melodic/rhythmic/harmonic dictations, and
listening analysis.

name: Intro To Nematology
description:
The relationship of nematodes to human environment. Classification,
morphology, ecology, distribution, and importance of nematodes occurring in
water and soil as parasites of plants and animals.
prereq: BIS 001B; or Consent of Instructor. Or the equivalent.

name: Intro to Symbol Logic
description:
Syntax and semantics of the symbolic language sentence logic. Symbols of
sentence logic. Translation between sentence logic and English. Truth table
interpretation of sentence logic. Proof techniques. Application of truth
tables and proof techniques to arguments in English.

name: Developmental Biology
description:
Analysis of the mechanistic basis for animal development with a focus on
experimental evidence and the relevant fundamental experimental strategies.
Fertilization and early development, morphogenesis and patterning, cell
differentiation, regulation of cell proliferation and tissue growth.

name: Special Study
description: Special study for advanced undergraduates.

name: Intro Microbiology Lab
description:
Introduction to principles and laboratory methods employed in working with
microorganisms. Designed for students requiring microbiology for professional
school admission. May be taught abroad.

name: Honors Physics
description: Special relativity, thermal physics. Continuation of PHY 009HA.
prereq: (PHY 009HA or PHY 009A); MAT 021C { can be concurrent }

name: Voice
description: Individual instruction in voice.
prereq: Consent of Instructor. Admission by audition.

name: Classical Physics
description: Electricity and magnetism including circuits and Maxwell's equations.
prereq: PHY 009B; MAT 021D; MAT 022A { can be concurrent }

name: Intro To Leadership
description:
Military leadership fundamentals to include setting direction, problem-
solving, presenting briefs, and using effective writing skills. Basic military
tactics, orienteering and land navigation. Dimensions of leadership values,
attributes, skills, and actions.

name: Intro Cognitive Science
description:
Introduction to the interdisciplinary cognitive scientific approach to the
study of mind, drawing concepts and methods from psychology, philosophy,
linguistics, artificial intelligence, and other disciplines.

name: Discov & Concepts
Forage Crop Production
description:
Forages as a world resource in food production. Ecological principles
governing the adaptation, establishment, growth and management of perennial
and annual forages, including pastures, rangelands and hay; aspects of forage
quality which affect feeding value to livestock.
prereq: PLS 002 or BIS 001C or BIS 002C; or Consent of Instructor.

name: Keyboard Competence
description:
Training to meet the minimum piano requirements for the major in music.
Harmonic progressions, modulations and score reading at the piano.
prereq:
MUS 002A; (MUS 006B { can be concurrent }, MUS 016B { can be concurrent });
Consent of Instructor. MUS 006B and MUS 016B required concurrently. Completion
of MUS 002A or demonstration of required keyboard proficiency level on
diagnostic exam.

name: Discov & Concepts
Molec Biol & Biochem Lab
description:
Introduction to laboratory methods and procedures employed in studying
molecular biology and biochemical processes. Designed for students who need
experience in the use of molecular biology and biochemical techniques as
research and analytical tools.

name: Modern Linear Algebra
description:
Rigorous treatment of linear algebra; topics include vector spaces, bases and
dimensions, orthogonal projections, eigenvalues and eigenvectors, similarity
transformations, singular value decomposition and positive definiteness.
prereq: MAT 021C C- or better or MAT 021CH C- or better

name: Combinatorics
description:
Combinatorial methods using basic graph theory, counting methods, generating
functions, and recurrence relations. Designed to serve as preparation for the
more rigorous upper division courses.

name: Intermediate Theory
description:
Harmony and voice of the 19th century leading through the music of the
Romantic era. Focus on analysis of music by Chopin, Schumann, Brahms, Wagner,
and Wolf. Composition of character pieces and songs. Intended for Music
majors.

name: Meaning & Identity
description:
Study of religious lives, the quest for meaning and for personal identity; how
religions frame the problems of life; how cultural and personal crises affect
youthful identity; the nature and structure of dreams, myths, and ideals.

name: Issues & Methods
description: Principal issues and methods of Religious Studies and associated fields.

name: Pol Global Ineq
description:
Analysis of current economic and political international relations resulting
from a long standing division of the global system into rich and poor regions.

name: Cognitive Psychology
description:
Introduction to human information processing, mental representation and
transformation, imagery, attention, memory, language processing, concept
formation, problem solving, and computer simulation.

name: Intermediate Portuguese
description:
Continuation of course 21. Focus on more difficult grammar concepts and
further composition practice. Development of all language skills through
exercises and reading of modern texts.

name: Seminar
description: Intensive treatment of a special topic or problem of psychological interest.
prereq: Junior or senior standing; major in Psychology or consent of instructor.

name: Intro Microbiology
description:
Essentials of microbial biology, emphasizing phylogeny, physiology, genetics,
ecology, and pathogenesis. Interactions with other microbes, humans, and the
biosphere. Uses of microbes in agriculture and biotechnology. May be taught
abroad.
prereq: (BIS 001A or BIS 002A); CHE 002B { can be concurrent }

name: Mktg for Tech Enterprise
description:
Quantitative analysis of needs in a product (technology-based) economy, with
emphasis on how scientists, engineers, and business people interact to develop
and market products and services.

name: Plant Biology
description:
The social and natural science of plants. Cultural history and socioeconomic
importance of plants. Biology of plants reproduction, including flowers, seeds
and fruits. Historical, cultural, religious and medicinal uses of plants.
Plants in the visual arts, music and literature.

name: Kant
description:
Immanuel Kant's Critique of Pure Reason and related writings. Topics include
the nature of human cognition, space and time, a priori concepts, substance,
causality, human freedom, and the existence of God.

name: Intro Nut & Metabolism
prereq: CHE 008B; NPB 101; Or the equivalent of NPB 101.

name: NAS Ethno History
description: Study of Native American ethno-history in North America before 1770s.
prereq: Upper division standing or consent of instructor.

name: Physical Activities
description:
Physical Education Activities classes offered in the following areas:
aquatics, personal fitness, martial arts, individual sports, and team sports.
These academic classes are instructional rather than recreational and are
intended to improve activity specific skills and knowledge.

name: Discrete Mathematics
description:
Coding theory, error correcting codes, finite fields and the algebraic
concepts needed in their development.

name: Developmental Psychology
description:
An ontogenetic account of human behavior through adolescence with emphasis on
motor skills, mental abilities, motivation, and social interaction.

name: Military Law
description:
The United States Constitution and the Military Justice System. Basic law of
war, with an emphasis on issues that might arise on the battlefield or during
a national emergency.
prereq: MSC 141; or Consent of Instructor. Upper division standing.

name: Intro to NA Lit
description:
Intensive focus on analysis of Native American literary texts, with frequent
writing assignments to develop critical thinking and composition skills.

name: Intro to NA Lit
description:
Intensive focus on analysis of Native American literary texts, with frequent
writing assignments to develop critical thinking and composition skills.

name: Physical Activities
description:
Physical Education Activities classes offered in the following areas:
aquatics, personal fitness, martial arts, individual sports, and team sports.
These academic classes are instructional rather than recreational and are
intended to improve activity specific skills and knowledge.

name: Electricity & Magnetism
description:
Theory of electrostatics, electromagnetism, Maxwell's equations,
electromagnetic waves.
prereq:
PHY 009B C- or better; PHY 009C C- or better; PHY 009D C- or better; MAT 021D
C- or better; MAT 022A C- or better; MAT 022B C- or better; or consent of
department.

name: Global Climate Change
description:
Causes of global climate change and the biological, geophysical, and social
consequences of such change. Methods used by different scientists for
predicting future events. Complexity of global affairs. Decision making under
uncertainty.

name: Developmental Disorders
description:
Current scientific knowledge of the influences of biological, cognitive, and
environmental factors on the emergence of disorders with onset in childhood.
Examples include autism spectrum, ADD/ADHD, dyslexia and dyscalculia. Emphasis
placed on understanding these disorders, their causes and their treatments.
prereq: PSC 001; PSC 041; (PSC 140 or PSC 141 or HDE 100A or HDE 100B)

name: Journalism
description:
Non-fiction for magazines and newspapers, with attention to style and
language. Emphasis on research, interviewing, market analysis, and query
letters.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Animals in Society
description:
Contributions of animals to human society, including historic, anthropologic,
developmental, human health and therapeutic perspectives, as well as effects
of humans on animals. One field trip required.
prereq: Upper division standing or consent of instructor.

name: Neurobiology
description:
Brains and nervous systems, neurons and neural circuits. Coordination of
movement. Development of nervous systems. Vision, hearing, and feature
extraction by the central nervous system. The cell biology of learning and
memory. Perception, cognition, and disorders of the brain.
prereq:
BIS 002A; BIS 002B; BIS 002C; PHY 009A, 009B, 009C or PHY 007A, 007B, 007C
recommended.

name: ICA Sports Program
description:
Classes offered in all UC Davis intercollegiate athletic sports and are
restricted to student-athletes who are members.

name: General Physics
description:
Introduction to general principles and analytical methods used in physics for
students majoring in a biological science.

name: Physical Activities
description:
Physical Education Activities classes offered in the following areas:
aquatics, personal fitness, martial arts, individual sports, and team sports.
These academic classes are instructional rather than recreational and are
intended to improve activity specific skills and knowledge.

name: Nutrition Tutoring
description:
Tutoring of students in nutrition courses, assistance with discussion groups
or laboratory sections, weekly conference with instructor in charge of course:
written evaluations.
prereq: Consent of Instructor. Nutrition Science, Clinical Nutrition or related major.

name: Physical Activities
description:
Physical Education Activities classes offered in the following areas:
aquatics, personal fitness, martial arts, individual sports, and team sports.
These academic classes are instructional rather than recreational and are
intended to improve activity specific skills and knowledge.

name: Intermed Symbolic Logic
description:
Predicate logic syntax and semantics. Transcription between predicate logic
and English. Proof techniques. Identity, functions, and definite descriptions.
Introduction to concepts of metatheory.

name: Classical Physics
description:
Continuation of PHY 009A. Fluid mechanics, thermodynamics, wave phenomena,
optics.
prereq: PHY 009A; MAT 021C; MAT 021D { can be concurrent }

name: Chamber Music
description:
Open to any student in the University whose proficiency meets the requirements
of concert performance. Study, rehearsal, and performance of ensemble music
for strings, winds, voice, piano, harpsichord, and organ.
prereq: Consent of Instructor. Admission by audition.

name: Willow Clinic
description:
Student run clinic for upper division students interested in learning about
and meeting the unique health care needs for the homeless population.
prereq: Consent of Instructor. UC Davis enrollment; upper division standing.

name: Scientific Study Politic
description:
Introduction to the basic principles of the scientific study of politics.
Research design and empirical analysis of data with applications to different
methodological approaches and different substantive areas in political
science.

name: Analytical Mechanic
description:
Principles and applications of Newtonian mechanics; introduction to Lagranges
and Hamiltons equations
prereq:
PHY 104A C or better; PHY 105A C or better; Or consent of department for any
of the courses.

name: Intro Music History
description:
History of music from the Romantic Period to the 19th century. Intended
primarily for majors in Music.

name: Euclidean Geometry
description:
An axiomatic and analytic examination of Euclidean geometry from an advanced
point of view. In particular, a discussion of its relation to other
geometries. Designed to serve as preparation for the more rigorous upper
division courses.

name: Quechua Beginning 2
description:
Second Level of the teaching of Quechua language and society. Emphasis on
development of conversational and reading skills. Continuation of the study of
aspects of contemporary Andean society and the status of Quechua language
today.

name: Microbial Diversity
description:
Survey of the major groups of microorganisms emphasizing diversity of energy
metabolism, morphology, evolution, and natural history.
prereq: MIC 102 or MIC 104; BIS 101; BIS 103 or BIS 105 strongly recommended.

name: Prof Act Men & Wom
description:
Fundamental skills for: (a) coaching competitive athletics; (b) classroom
teaching and coaching, and (c) classroom teaching and officiating. May be
repeated for a total of six units.

name: Disease & Society
description:
Introduction to the concept of disease, the societal and personal impacts of
past, present and future diseases, and the science behind disease discoveries,
causes, evolution, diagnosis, treatment, and prevention.

name: Pol of Interdependence
description:
In the past several decades, growing economic interdependence has generated
new problems in international relations. Deals with difficulties in managing
complex interdependence and its implication on national policies and politics.

name: Research Meth in Psych
description:
Introduction to experimental design, interviews, questionnaires, field and
observational methods, reliability, and statistical inference.
prereq:
PSC 001; Or the equivalent to PSC 001; completion of STA 013 or STA 102
strongly recommended.

name: Elementary Russian
description: Continuation of grammar and language skills developed in RUS 001.

name: Intermed Musicianship
description:
Melodic, rhythmic, and harmonic materials of Western music. Includes sight
singing, explanations, drills, melodic/rhythmic/harmonic dictations, and
listening analysis.
prereq:
MUS 017A; (MUS 007B { can be concurrent }; MUS 007B required concurrently.
Completion of MUS 017A or demonstration of required proficiency level on
diagnostic exam.

name: Cell Biology Laboratory
description:
Exercises illustrating the principles of cell biology with emphasis on light
microscopy.

name: Clinical Nutrition
description:
Biochemical and physiological bases for therapeutic diets. Problems in
planning diets for normal and pathological conditions.
prereq:
(NUT 111AV or NUT 111AY); NUT 111B; NUT 112; NPB 101; Or the equivalent to NPB
101.

name: Plant Growth & Yield
description:
Principles of the cellular mechanisms and hormonal regulation underlying plant
growth, development, and reproduction. Emphasis on how these processes
contribute to the harvestable yield of cultivated plants and can be managed to
increase crop productivity and quality.

name: Elementary Theory
description: Continuation of MUS 006A.
prereq:
MUS 002B { can be concurrent }; MUS 016B { can be concurrent }; required
concurrently; completion of MUS 006A or demonstration of required proficiency
level on diagnostic exam.

name: Adv Molecular Biology
description:
Structure, expression, and regulation of eukaryotic genes. Chromosome
structure and replication; gene structure, transcription, and RNA processing;
protein synthesis and translation control; development, immune system, and
oncogenes.
prereq:
BIS 101; (BIS 102 { can be concurrent } or BIS 105 { can be concurrent } or
ABI 102 { can be concurrent }); BIS 102 or BIS 105 or ABI 102 can be
concurrent although prior completion is recommended.

name: Prof Act Men & Wom
description:
Fundamental skills for: (a) coaching competitive athletics; (b) classroom
teaching and coaching, and (c) classroom teaching and officiating. May be
repeated for a total of six units.

name: Advanced Russian
description:
Continuation of RUS 101A. Topics in Russian grammar for the advanced student.
Reading and discussion of journalistic texts and classic and contemporary
literature. Conversational exercises utilizing literary and colloquial
variants of current Russian speech.

name: Behavioral Epigenetics
description:
Review of basic principles in genetics and epigenetics with emphasis on
behavior. Introduction to the use of modern molecular methods in understanding
the complex relationships between genes, environment, and behavior.

name: Psychology of the Self
description:
Psychological theory and research on the self. Topics include: self-knowledge,
self-esteem, self-regulation, self-presentation, cognitive and emotional
aspects of the self, and the role of the self in shaping social interaction.

name: Internship
description:
Work experience on or off campus in subject areas pertaining to plant and
environmental sciences. Internship supervised by a faculty member.
prereq: Consent of Instructor. Completion of 84 units.

name: Academic Literacies
description:
Composition, the essay, paragraph structure, diction, and related topics.
Frequent writing assignments.

name: Pub Pol & Gov Proc
description:
Processes of formulating public policy, including individual and collective
decision making, political exchange, competition, bargaining, coalition
formation and the allocation of public goods, resources and opportunities.

name: Minds, Brains, Computers
description:
Computational theories of the nature of the mind. Mind as a computer process.
Possibility of machine intelligence, consciousness, and mentality.

name: Intro to NA Lit
description:
Intensive focus on analysis of Native American literary texts, with frequent
writing assignments to develop critical thinking and composition skills.

name: Genetics Lab
description:
Laboratory work in basic and molecular genetics including gene mapping,
isolation and characterization of mutants in eukaryotic model systems, reverse
genetics, gel electrophoresis, recombinant DNA techniques, and PCR.

name: Physical Activities
description:
Physical Education Activities classes offered in the following areas:
aquatics, personal fitness, martial arts, individual sports, and team sports.
These academic classes are instructional rather than recreational and are
intended to improve activity specific skills and knowledge.

name: Sports in Amer Society
description:
Sociological approaches to the study of sport and contemporary American
culture, including sport's interaction with politics, economics, religion,
gender, race, media and ethics. Socialization factors involving youth,
scholastic, collegiate, and Olympic sport.

name: Advanced Calculus
description:
Introduction to the rigorous treatment of abstract mathematical analysis.
Proofs in mathematics, induction, sets, cardinality; real number system,
theory of convergence of sequences.

name: Scientific Study Politic
description:
Introduction to the basic principles of the scientific study of politics.
Research design and empirical analysis of data with applications to different
methodological approaches and different substantive areas in political
science.

name: Computers in Technology
description:
Concepts of computing and applications using personal computers, spreadsheets,
database management, word processing and communications.

name: Tutor Plant Sciences
description:
Leading small voluntary discussion or lab groups affiliated with one of the
department's regular courses.
prereq:
Consent of Instructor. Upper division standing, completion of course being
tutored or the equivalent.

name: Social & Personal Devel
description:
Social and personality development of children, infancy through adolescence.
Topics include the development of personality, achievement motivation, self-
understanding, sex-role identity, and antisocial behavior. Emphasis on the
interface between biological and social factors.

name: Academic Literacies
description:
Composition, the essay, paragraph structure, diction, and related topics.
Frequent writing assignments.

name: Human Memory
description:
Consideration of major theories of human learning and memory with critical
examination of relevant experimental data.
prereq: PSC 001; PSC 041; (STA 013 or STA 100); or Consent of Instructor.

name: Judicial Politics
description:
Politics of judicial policy making, issues surrounding constitutional
interpretation and decision making, prerequisite for courses on the politics
of constitutional law.

name: Physical Activities
description:
Physical Education Activities classes offered in the following areas:
aquatics, personal fitness, martial arts, individual sports, and team sports.
These academic classes are instructional rather than recreational and are
intended to improve activity specific skills and knowledge.

name: Physical Activities
description:
Physical Education Activities classes offered in the following areas:
aquatics, personal fitness, martial arts, individual sports, and team sports.
These academic classes are instructional rather than recreational and are
intended to improve activity specific skills and knowledge.

name: Phil Classics: Ancient
description:
Survey of Greek philosophy with special attention to the Pre-Socratics, Plato,
and Aristotle.

name: Intro Music Theory 2
description:
Continuation of MUS 003A. Development of melodic and harmonic writing skills.
Basic analysis training. Intended for the general student.

name: Microbial Diversity Lab
description:
Classical enrichments for the isolation of metabolically diverse microbes;
modern molecular methods for the identification of isolates; cultivation
independent analysis of microbial communities from local environmental
samples.
prereq: (MIC 102 or MIC 104); (MIC 102L or MIC 104L); MIC 105 { can be concurrent }

name: Prin Environ Physiol
description:
Physiological aspects of interactions of organisms and environmental,
cellular, system, and organismal levels. Emphasis on regulatory
responses/mechanisms to thermal, pressure, gravity and light environmental
variables.

name: Cognitive Neuroscience
description:
Neuroscientific foundations of higher mental processes including attention,
memory, language, higher-level perceptual and motor processes, and
consciousness. Emphasis on the neural mechanisms which form the substrates of
human cognition and the relationship of mind to brain.
prereq:
PSC 001; PSC 041; or Consent of Instructor. PSC 101, PSC 121, or PSC 129
recommended.

name: Elementary Portuguese
description:
Continuation of course 001 in the areas of grammar and development of all
basic language skills in cultural context with special emphasis on
communication.

name: Seminar
description: Intensive treatment of a special topic or problem of psychological interest.
prereq: Junior or senior standing; major in Psychology or consent of instructor.

name: Pop Sci & Technol Wrtng
description:
Positioning of science and technology in society as reflected and constructed
in popular texts. Topics include genre theory, demarcation, rhetorical
figures, forms of qualitative and quantitative reasoning, and the epistemic
role of popularization in science.

name: Textile Fabrics
description: Properties of fabrics as related to serviceability, comfort, and appearance.

name: Academic Literacies
description:
Composition, the essay, paragraph structure, diction, and related topics.
Frequent writing assignments.

name: Writing in Health Prof
description:
Advanced expository writing common in the health professions, emphasizing
effective communication between the writer and different audiences. Topics
relate to health, disability, and disease. Suitable for students planning
careers in professions such as medicine, dentistry, physical therapy,
optometry.
prereq: UWP 001; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Spanish Composition I
description:
Development of writing skills by way of reading, discussion, and analysis of
authentic materials, literary texts, and videos. Selective review of grammar.
Composition, journals, individual and group projects.
prereq: SPA 022 or SPA 022S or SPA 022V or SPA 022Y

name: Politics & Sports
description:
Core issues in American and world politics through the lens of sports and the
athletes who play them. Introduction of American civil rights movement, the
Cold War, Middle East Tensions, and democratization.

name: Intro Chinese Philosophy
description:
Introduction to Chinese philosophy from classical pre-modern times; emphasis
on basic concepts and their impact on social conduct; the Age of Philosophers,
the Han synthesis, the medieval Buddhist contribution.

name: Recent US Foreign Pol
description:
Broad survey of the development of U.S. foreign policy in 20th century with
emphasis on transformation of policy during and after World War II, and the
introduction to analytic tools and concepts useful for understanding of
current foreign policy issues.

name: Advancd Multiling Wrtng
description:
Reading and writing source/research-based texts for academic purposes.
Suitable for students whose primary home language was not English.

name: Special Study
description: Special study for advanced undergraduates.

name: Personality Psychology
description:
Scientific study of personality. Methods of personality research. Overview of
current research and theory in the field of personality psychology.

name: Directed Gp Study
description: Directed group study. May be taught abroad.

name: Elementary Spanish
description:
Completion of grammar sequence and continuing practice of all language skills
using cultural texts.
prereq: SPA 002 or SPA 002S or SPA 002V or SPA 002Y

name: Immigration
description:
Social and demographic analysis of immigration: motives and experiences of
immigrants; immigration and social mobility; immigration, assimilation, and
social change; multicultural societies. Detailed study of immigration into the
U.S., with comparative studies of Europe, Australia, and other host countries.

name: Advancd Multiling Wrtng
description:
Reading and writing source/research-based texts for academic purposes.
Suitable for students whose primary home language was not English.

name: Applied Statistics
description:
Descriptive statistics; probability; random variables; expectation; binomial,
normal, Poisson, other univariate distributions; joint distributions; sampling
distributions, central limit theorem; properties of estimators; linear
combinations of random variables; testing and estimation; Minitab computing
package.
prereq: (STA 013 or STA 032 or STA 100); (MAT 016B or MAT 017C or MAT 021B)

name: College Writing-SCC157E
description: Not available.

name: Academic Literacies
description:
Composition, the essay, paragraph structure, diction, and related topics.
Frequent writing assignments.

name: Topics in Lat Am Lit Cul
description: Special topics in the study of Latin American literature and culture.
prereq: SPA 100 or SPA 100S or SPA 141 or SPA 141S or SPA 170 or SPA 170S

name: College Writing-SCC157S
description: Not available.

name: Writing in Science
description:
Writing abstracts, research proposals, scientific papers, other forms of
scientific communication. Presenting data graphically. Primarily for students
engaged in or planning careers in basic or applied research.
prereq:
UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing or
enrollment in a graduate science curriculum.

name: Intro Gender Studies
description:
Introduction to interdisciplinary, critical gender studies. Addresses the
emergence of womens, gender and feminist studies internationally, its links
to womens movements, and its influence within the various arts, humanities
and social science disciplines.

name: College Writing-SCC157P
description: Not available.

name: Stat Analys Psych Data
description:
Probability theory, sampling distributions, statistical inference, and
hypothesis testing using standard parametric and correlational approaches.
Simple regression analysis, multiple regression analysis, non-parametric
statistics, introduction to multivariate statistics, with applications in
psychology.

name: Res In Practical Pol
description:
Supervised preparation of an extensive paper relating internship experience to
concepts, literature, and theory of political science.
prereq:
POL 192A; POL 192B; open only to Political Science-Public Service majors, for
whom it is required.

name: Pol Theory: Early Modern
description:
Critical analysis of the works of early modern political philosophers such as
Machiavelli, Montaigne, Hobbes, Locke and Hume.

name: Agent-Based Modeling
description:
Introduction to agent-based computer simulation and analysis with emphasis on
learning how to model animals, including humans, to achieve insight into
social and group behavior.

name: Spanish Cultural Studies
description:
Study of specific historical tendencies in Spanish culture(s) from the Romans
to the present. Sources studied may include literature, film, art, journalism,
and performance. Approaches to material may address issues of aesthetics,
politics, identity, and globalization.

name: Writing in the Fine Arts
description:
Advanced instruction in writing about the arts and practice in effective
styles of communication.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Directed Group Study
description: Directed group study.

name: Feminist Research
description:
Feminist applications and transformations of traditional disciplinary
practices; current issues and methodologies in feminist interdisciplinary
work.
prereq: WMS 050 recommended or consent of instructor.

name: Business Writing
description:
Effective communication in and for organizations, including businesses
(corporations), government agencies, and non-profit organizations. Suitable
for students entering careers that require substantial communications, such as
management, public relations, and grant writing.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Deviance
description:
Social structural sources, institutional practices and microprocesses
associated with illegality, evil, disease, immorality, disability, racial and
class differences, citizenship, and the body. Special emphasis on expert
knowledge and the production and management of social difference.

name: Academic Literacies
description:
Composition, the essay, paragraph structure, diction, and related topics.
Frequent writing assignments.

name: Health Psychology
description:
Psychological factors influencing health and illness. Topics include stress
and coping, personality and health, symptom perception and reporting, heart
disease, cancer, compliance, and health maintenance and promotion.

name: Seminar on Altern Agric
description:
Seminar on topics related to alternative theories, practices and systems of
agriculture and the relationship of agriculture to the environment and
society. Scientific, technological, social, political and economic
perspectives.
prereq: Upper division standing or consent of instructor.

name: Public Sector Policy
description:
Theoretical rationale for governmental activity, program evaluation, PPBS,
positive theories of policy making, the quantitative study of policy
determinants, implementation, and proposals for improved decision making.

name: Internatl Relations
description:
International conflict and cooperation, including the Cold War, nuclear
weapons, and new techniques for understanding international politics.

name: Spanish for Bilinguals
description:
Designed for students interested in teaching Spanish to native speakers. Focus
on cultural diversity of the Spanish speaking population in the United States;
applied language teaching methodologies in the context of teaching Spanish to
native speakers at different levels.
prereq: SPA 024 or SPA 033; or Consent of Instructor. LIN 001 recommended.

name: College Writing-SCC157S
description: Not available.

name: 3D Computer Graphics
description:
A foundation course that teaches students the theory of three dimensional
computer graphics, including modeling, rendering and animation. Development of
practical skills through the use of professional software to create computer
graphics

name: Writing in History
description: Advanced instruction in writing in history.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Business Writing
description:
Effective communication in and for organizations, including businesses
(corporations), government agencies, and non-profit organizations. Suitable
for students entering careers that require substantial communications, such as
management, public relations, and grant writing.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: International Law
description:
Selected topics in international law; territory, sovereign immunity,
responsibility, the peaceful settlement or nonsettlement of international
disputes.

name: Advanced Composition
description:
Instruction in advanced principles of expository writing. Writing tasks within
and beyond the University. Different writing modes, including narrative,
analysis, explanation, argument, critique.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Business Writing
description:
Effective communication in and for organizations, including businesses
(corporations), government agencies, and non-profit organizations. Suitable
for students entering careers that require substantial communications, such as
management, public relations, and grant writing.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Writing in Health Prof
description:
Advanced expository writing common in the health professions, emphasizing
effective communication between the writer and different audiences. Topics
relate to health, disability, and disease. Suitable for students planning
careers in professions such as medicine, dentistry, physical therapy,
optometry.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Analysis of Variance
description:
Basics of experimental design. One-way and two-way fixed effects analysis of
variance models. Randomized complete and incomplete block design. Multiple
comparisons procedures. One-way random effects model.

name: Anly Categor Data
description:
Varieties of categorical data, cross-classifications, contingency tables,
tests for independence. Multidimensional tables and log-linear models, maximum
likelihood estimation; tests of goodness-of-fit. Logit models, linear logistic
models. Analysis of incomplete tables. Packaged computer programs, analysis of
real data.

name: Wine Stability Lab
description:
Practical application of principles of equilibria and rates of physical and
chemical reactions to wine stability.
prereq: VEN 126 { can be concurrent }; and Consent of Instructor.

name: Population
description:
Introduction to the study of human population, including theories and
statistical measures; social causes and consequences of population trends;
changes in population structure; geographical distribution, migration,
sociopsychological factors affecting fertility.

name: Math Statistics
description:
Sampling, methods of estimation, bias-variance decomposition, sampling
distributions, Fisher information, confidence intervals, and some elements of
hypothesis testing.
prereq: STA 131A or MAT 135A; or Consent of Instructor.

name: Govt & The Economy
description:
Political basis of economic policy (taxation, spending and regulation); impact
of prices, employment and growth on political demands; elite responses to
economic conditions; policy alternatives and the public interest.

name: Elementary Statistics
description:
Descriptive statistics; basic probability concepts; binomial, normal,
Student's t, and chi-square distributions. Hypothesis testing and confidence
intervals for one and two means and proportions. Regression.
prereq: Two years of high school algebra or Mathematics D.

name: Advanced Composition
description:
Instruction in advanced principles of expository writing. Writing tasks within
and beyond the University. Different writing modes, including narrative,
analysis, explanation, argument, critique.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: College Writing-SCC157S
description: Not available.

name: Academic Literacies
description:
Composition, the essay, paragraph structure, diction, and related topics.
Frequent writing assignments.

name: Clothing Mat Sci
description:
The properties, characterization, and performance evaluation of clothing
materials and structures for specific functional applications. Principles and
methods related to wetting and transport properties, fabric hand and aesthetic
properties, clothing comfort, and material and assembly technology.

name: Intrmed Multiling Wrtng
description:
Reading and writing short multi-paragraph texts for academic purposes.
Suitable for students whose primary home language was not English.

name: Writing in Education
description:
Advanced expository writing in the contemporary American classroom. Strongly
recommended for teaching credential candidates.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Ecol Human-Wildl Confl
description:
Ecological approaches to managing wild vertebrates that come into conflict
with agriculture, public health, or the conservation of biodiversity.

name: Directed Gp Study
description: Primarily for lower division students. May be taught abroad.
prereq: Consent of instructor and department chairperson.

name: Writing in Engineering
description: Advanced instruction in writing in engineering.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Writing in Engineering
description: Advanced instruction in writing in engineering.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Regression Analysis
description:
Simple linear regression, variable selection techniques, stepwise regression,
analysis of covariance, influence measures, computing packages.

name: 20th C Spanish Fiction
description:
Study of the main literary trends and authors of the modern Spanish novel and
short story. Selected works by Unamuno, Valle-Incln, Sender, Cela, Matute,
Ayala and others.
prereq: SPA 100 or SPA 100S or SPA 141 or SPA 141S or SPA 170 or SPA 170S

name: Academic Literacies
description:
Composition, the essay, paragraph structure, diction, and related topics.
Frequent writing assignments.

name: Development of Memory
description: Theory and research on memory development with focus on infancy and childhood.
prereq:
PSC 001; PSC 041; and any Psychology upper division course from Core Group A
or D.

name: Genocide
description:
Comparative and critical study of the modern phenomenon of genocide from
religious, ethical and historical perspectives.

name: Textile Fabric Lab
description:
Laboratory methods and procedures employed in studying properties of textile
fabrics as related to serviceability, comfort, and appearance.

name: Topics In Judaism
description:
Examination of selected aspects of Jewish life, religion, or literature.
Potential topics include: Jewish Perspectives on Jesus; The Golem: History and
Legend; Sexuality and Gender in Late Antique Judaism and Early Christianity.

name: Internship
description:
Upper-division internship for students enrolled in the Sustainable Agriculture
and Food Systems program of study.
prereq: Consent of Instructor. Upper division standing.

name: Social & Personal Devel
description:
Social and personality development of children, infancy through adolescence.
Topics include the development of personality, achievement motivation, self-
understanding, sex-role identity, and antisocial behavior. Emphasis on the
interface between biological and social factors.

name: Elementary Spanish
description:
Introduction to Spanish grammar and development of all language skills in a
cultural context with special emphasis on communication.

name: Russian Film
description:
History of Russian film; film & social revolution, the cult of Stalin,
dissident visions; film & the collapse of the Soviet empire; gender and the
nation in Russian film. Taught in English; Russian films with English
subtitles.

name: General Psychology
description:
Principles and basic concepts of psychology. The empirical study of individual
behavior including perception, cognition, development, personality, social
interactions and the biological underpinnings of behavior.

name: Kids in Garden & Farm
description:
Methods of teaching children and youth about fruit and vegetable production
and consumption. Lesson and activity planning for garden and farm field trips.
Basic biology, ecology, plant science, and crop management practices.
Mentorship in experiential learning. Preparation of garden site.
prereq: Upper division standing or consent of instructor.

name: Advanced Composition
description:
Instruction in advanced principles of expository writing. Writing tasks within
and beyond the University. Different writing modes, including narrative,
analysis, explanation, argument, critique.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Abrahamic Religions
description:
History of religion in the ancient Near East and Mediterranean, from the
Persian period through the rise of Islam. Emphasis on historical and social
contexts of the formation of new traditions, in particular Judaism,
Christianity, and Islam.

name: Stat Analys Psych Data
description:
Design and statistical analysis of psychological investigations and the
interpretation of quantitative data in psychology.

name: Topics: Hist Pol Thought
description:
Political thought of a specific historical period. Topics may include: Ancient
Athens, the Italian Renaissance, the Enlightenment, or 19th-century Germany.

name: Advancd Multiling Wrtng
description:
Reading and writing source/research-based texts for academic purposes.
Suitable for students whose primary home language was not English.

name: Immigration
description:
Social and demographic analysis of immigration: motives and experiences of
immigrants; immigration and social mobility; immigration, assimilation, and
social change; multicultural societies. Detailed study of immigration into the
U.S., with comparative studies of Europe, Australia, and other host countries.

name: Advanced Composition
description:
Instruction in advanced principles of expository writing. Writing tasks within
and beyond the University. Different writing modes, including narrative,
analysis, explanation, argument, critique.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Developmental Psychobiol
description:
The biology of behavioral development; survey and integration of the
organismic and environmental processes that regulate the development of
behavior.

name: Advancd Multiling Wrtng
description:
Reading and writing source/research-based texts for academic purposes.
Suitable for students whose primary home language was not English.

name: College Writing-SCC157E
description: Not available.

name: Relationship Science
description:
Evolutionary perspectives on attraction and close relationships. Integrating
social psychological and evolutionary theories with empirical evidence
pertaining to human mating.
prereq:
PSC 001; or introductory social science course or introductory life science
course.

name: Intro to Bio Psych
description:
Survey and integration of the relationships between behavior and biological
processes, including physiology, genes, development, ecology, and evolution.

name: Comp Electoral Systems
description:
Workings of electoral institutions, focusing on systems used to elect
presidents and assemblies, pass laws, and generally make decisions. Examples
from systems throughout the world, including cases from both the advanced
industrial and developing worlds.

name: Special Study
description: Special study for advanced undergraduates.

name: Spanish Composition II
description:
Development of advanced level writing skills, with emphasis on how to write
argumentative prose, essays, and research papers. Introduction to the analysis
of literary genres. Compositions, journals, individual and group projects.

name: Principles Lit Criticism
description:
Principles of literary criticism applied to the study of fiction, drama,
poetry, and essay of major literary writers of the Hispanic world.

name: Elementary Spanish
description:
Continuation of courses 1 and 1S in the areas of grammar and basic language
skills.
prereq: SPA 001 or SPA 001S; Or the equivalent.

name: Academic Literacies
description:
Composition, the essay, paragraph structure, diction, and related topics.
Frequent writing assignments.

name: Mexican Culture
description:
Study of Mexican culture through a diversity of cultural expression, including
elite, popular and mass media culture. Focus on national icons and archetypes,
multiculturalism, transnationalism.

name: Applied Stat for Bio Sci
description:
Descriptive statistics, probability, sampling distributions, estimation,
hypothesis testing, contingency tables, ANOVA, regression; implementation of
statistical methods using computer package.

name: Gender & Science
description:
Interdisciplinary approach to the relations between gender and science. Topics
include the biological and cultural construction of sexual difference, the
role of women as practitioners of science, and feminist approaches to science.

name: College Writing-SCC157E
description: Not available.

name: Advancd Multiling Wrtng
description:
Reading and writing source/research-based texts for academic purposes.
Suitable for students whose primary home language was not English.

name: Writing in Health Prof
description:
Advanced expository writing common in the health professions, emphasizing
effective communication between the writer and different audiences. Topics
relate to health, disability, and disease. Suitable for students planning
careers in professions such as medicine, dentistry, physical therapy,
optometry.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Sounds & Words
description:
Linguistic description of the sound patterns of Spanish and how those sounds
can be used to form larger units, such as morphemes and words. Theoretical and
practical comparisons with English and with other Romance languages. (Former
SPA 132.)
prereq: (SPA 024 or SPA 033); or Consent of Instructor. LIN 001 recommended.

name: Language & Cognition
description:
Introduction to the cognitive processes involved in language comprehension and
production. Topics include the biological foundations of language, speech
perception, word recognition, syntax, reading ability, and pragmatics.
prereq: PSC 001; PSC 041; (PSC 100 or PSC 135); or Consent of Instructor.

name: Psychology of Emotion
description:
An introduction to current theories and research on emotion and bodily
feelings with special reference to self-knowledge.

name: Theories Int'l Politics
description:
Major contemporary approaches to the study of international politics,
including balance of power, game theory, Marxist-Leninist theory, systems
theory, and decision-making analysis.

name: Internship Pub Aff
description:
Supervised internship and study in political, governmental, or related
organizations.
prereq:
POL 192A; enrollment dependent on availability of intern positions with
highest priority assigned to students with Political Science-Public Service
major; upper division standing.

name: Global Poverty
description:
Social science and engineering analysis of causes and effects of world poverty
and of policies to reduce it via economic growth, foreign aid, and community-
level interventions; e.g., in potable water, sanitation, lighting, small scale
energy, irrigation, health and microfinance.

name: Business Writing
description:
Effective communication in and for organizations, including businesses
(corporations), government agencies, and non-profit organizations. Suitable
for students entering careers that require substantial communications, such as
management, public relations, and grant writing.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Gateway to Data Science
description:
Probability concepts: Events and sample spaces; random variables; mass,
density and distribution functions; parametric families; parameter estimation
and confidence intervals; hypothesis testing; Central Limit Theorem.
Recommended as alternative to course 13 for students with a background in
calculus and programming.
prereq:
MAT 016B or MAT 021B or MAT 017C; Ability to program in a high-level computer
language.

name: Stat Data Technologies
description:
Essentials of using relational databases and SQL. Processing data in blocks.
Scraping Web pages and using Web services/APIs. Basics of text mining.
Interactive data visualization with Web technologies. Computational data
workflow and best practices. Statistical methods.

name: Writing in Science
description:
Writing abstracts, research proposals, scientific papers, other forms of
scientific communication. Presenting data graphically. Primarily for students
engaged in or planning careers in basic or applied research.
prereq:
UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing or
enrollment in a graduate science curriculum.

name: Business Writing
description:
Effective communication in and for organizations, including businesses
(corporations), government agencies, and non-profit organizations. Suitable
for students entering careers that require substantial communications, such as
management, public relations, and grant writing.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Business Writing
description:
Effective communication in and for organizations, including businesses
(corporations), government agencies, and non-profit organizations. Suitable
for students entering careers that require substantial communications, such as
management, public relations, and grant writing.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Writing in Bio Sci
description: Advanced instruction in writing in biology.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Wine Stability
description:
Principles of equilibria and rates of physical and chemical reactions in
wines; treatment of unstable components in wines by adsorption, ion exchange,
refrigeration, filtration, and membrane processes; and protein,
polysaccharide, tartrate, oxidative and color stabilities.

name: Intro Comp Politics
description:
Introduction to basic concepts in political analysis and application of them
in comparative studies of selected countries. Coverage is given to cultural
and other informal dimensions of politics as well as to more formal political
and governmental structures.

name: Business Writing
description:
Effective communication in and for organizations, including businesses
(corporations), government agencies, and non-profit organizations. Suitable
for students entering careers that require substantial communications, such as
management, public relations, and grant writing.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Advanced Composition
description:
Instruction in advanced principles of expository writing. Writing tasks within
and beyond the University. Different writing modes, including narrative,
analysis, explanation, argument, critique.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Applied Psychrometrics
description:
Examination of the basic principles and applications of classical and modern
test theory. Topics include test construction, reliability theory, validity
theory, factor analysis and latent trait theory.
prereq: PSC 041; PSC 103; STA 013; Upper division standing in Psychology.

name: Academic Literacies
description:
Composition, the essay, paragraph structure, diction, and related topics.
Frequent writing assignments.

name: Elementary Statistics
description:
Descriptive statistics; basic probability concepts; binomial, normal,
Student's t, and chi-square distributions. Hypothesis testing and confidence
intervals for one and two means and proportions. Regression.
prereq: Two years of high school algebra or Mathematics D.

name: Writing in Science
description:
Writing abstracts, research proposals, scientific papers, other forms of
scientific communication. Presenting data graphically. Primarily for students
engaged in or planning careers in basic or applied research.
prereq:
UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing or
enrollment in a graduate science curriculum.

description: Not available.

to sociocultural change and programs for improvement.

and beyond the University. Different writing modes, including narrative,
analysis, explanation, argument, critique.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

description:
